courses.name: Introduction to Respiratory Therapy
courses.description: Introductory course to assist students acquiring information about the respiratory therapy profession. Students observe therapists in hospitals and participate in lectures on credentialing, program requirements, placement and future trends in the profession. Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Fundamentals of Respiratory Care
courses.description: Orientation to the profession.  Focus on professional attributes of communication, teamwork, licensure and safety.

courses.name: Equipment and Techniques
courses.description: History, organization of respiratory therapy.  Theory, application of gas laws.  Equipment for invasive and non-invasive pulmonary assessment, therapeutic aerosol and humidity, gas delivery, airway management.  Techniques for infection control, lung expansion, bronchial hygiene.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Cardiopulmonary Pharmacology
courses.description: To provide the student with specific knowledge of the pharmacologic strategies in treating cardiopulmonary disorders.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: restricted to students in the respiratory therapy program

courses.name: Principles of Mechanical Ventilation
courses.description: Continuation of RS_THR 3220. Emphasis on the principles of mechanical ventilation, including physiologic and clinical application.

courses.name: Principles of Mechanical Ventilation - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Continuation of RS_THR 3220. Emphasis on the principles of mechanical ventilation, including physiologic and clinical application.

courses.name: Mechanical Ventilation Lab
courses.description: Application of mechanical ventilation emphasizing acute care: pressure, volume, and oscillatory ventilation of adults.  Pediatrics, and infants.  Related graphical, laboratory,and hemodynamic analysis; therapeutic intervention.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Clinical Practice I
courses.description: To be taken concurrently with RS_THR 3220 for which it serves as an extension of the laboratory time and an opportunity for structured clinical experience exposures.

courses.name: Clinical Practice II
courses.description: To be taken concurrently with  RS_THR 3420, for which it serves as an extension of the laboratory time, and an opportunity for structured clinical experience exposures.

courses.name: Clinical Practice III
courses.description: Continuation of supervised clinical experience from  RS_THR 3942. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Perinatal/Neonatal Respiratory Care
courses.description: Evaluation and management of perinatal/neonatal pulmonary, medical and surgical conditions which require respiratory care. Emphasis on resuscitation, pathophysiology, evaluation, blood gas and x-ray interpretation, treatment and mechanical ventilation.

courses.name: Respiratory Pathophysiology
courses.description: Clinical pulmonary disease, organized around the gross structural components of the lung, airways, alveoli and pulmonary vasculature. Impact of disease on normal structure function; clinical, roentgenographic, and physiologic manifestations are described.

courses.name: Problems in Respiratory Therapy
courses.description: Independent work on special problems related to cardiopulmonary health. Course not offered for graduate credit. Some sections of the course may be graded on either A-F or S/U basis only.

courses.name: Community and Patient Education I
courses.description: Design and implement materials for educational presentations for a given patient population. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Pulmonary Rehabilitation
courses.description: Focus is on an interdisciplinary approach to pulmonary rehabilitation and home care of the adult cardiopulmonary patient. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Pediatric Respiratory Care
courses.description: Evaluation and management of pulmonary, medical and surgical pediatric conditions requiring respiratory care. Emphasis on pediatric resuscitation, pathophysiology, treatment and prevention of respiratory conditions, mechanical ventilation, lab interpretation.

courses.name: Organization and Administration
courses.description: (same as RA_SCI 4440 and CPD 4440). Examines design and operation of allied health service departments and educational programs, including facilities, personnel procedures, record systems, ethics, medical-legal aspects, interdepartmental relations and curriculum development.

courses.name: Evidence-Based Medicine in Respiratory Care
courses.description: This course is intended to facilitate the development of the student's ability to obtain and integrate patient assessment information and key findings and to formulate clinical decisions in respiratory therapy practice as well as use an evidence-based medicine approach to define respiratory clinical practice.

courses.name: Evidence-Based Medicine in Respiratory Care - Writing Intensive
courses.description: This course is intended to facilitate the development of the student's ability to obtain and integrate patient assessment information and key findings and to formulate clinical decisions in respiratory therapy practice as well as use an evidence-based medicine approach to define respiratory clinical practice.

courses.name: Pulmonary Function Technologies
courses.description: This course will provide the student with a specific knowledge of the testing procedures and equipment for pulmonary function technology.  The student will learn to interpret pulmonary function tests and perform quality assurance within the pulmonary function laboratory.
courses.prerequisites: restricted to Respiratory Therapy students only

courses.name: Teaching Practicum
courses.description: Structured and supervised experience identifying student characteristics, methods for teaching, improving assessment, current development and instructional design.

courses.name: Advanced Mechanical Ventilation Theory
courses.description: Exploration of advanced disease management via specific disease processes as well as concepts and modes of mechanical ventilation.  Emphasis will be placed on mode selection for various disease and how new modes of mechanical ventilation impact disease management.

courses.name: Advanced Pulmonary Function Technology
courses.description: This course will focus on the respiratory therapist's role in diagnostic testing. Topics include pulmonary function tests, exercise tests, and metabolic studies. In addition the course briefly addresses polysomnography, pulmonary rehabilitation, and home care.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Respiratory Therapy students only

courses.name: Adult Critical Care
courses.description: This course will focus on the respiratory therapist's role in the adult critical care environment.  Topics include airway management, mechanical ventilation, general adult critical care and functioning as a vital member of the critical care team.
courses.prerequisites: restricted to Respiratory Therapy students only

courses.name: Current Issues in Respiratory Care
courses.description: (cross-leveled with RS_THR 7930). Identification and analysis of current issues in Respiratory Care with practice implications. Emphasis given to identification and evaluation of nontraditional information sources (e.g., social networking, internet).  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: CDS 4955 or HLTH SCI 3900 or Instructor consent

courses.name: Clinical Practice IV
courses.description: Structured and supervised clinical experience and case conferences regarding bioterrorism response and emergency/disaster planning.

courses.name: Research in Respiratory Therapy
courses.description: Selected research projects guided by a senior staff member.

courses.name: Clinical Practice V
courses.description: An extension of the supervised practicum begun in RS_THR 4940. Emphasis in adult critical care and special procedures including brochoscopies, cardiac catherization and chest tube placement.

courses.name: Clinical Practice VI
courses.description: An extension of the supervised practicum begun in RS_THR 4940. Emphasis in perinatal and pediatric critical care including pediatric pulmonary function testing and airway management.

courses.name: Respiratory Therapy Capstone
courses.description: Integration of literature, knowledge of previous coursework and clinical experience.

courses.name: Clincal Practice VII
courses.description: An extension of the supervised practicum begun in  RS_THR 4940. Emphasis in rehabilitation and home care, inservice education, and management. Students will participate in on-going research projects and community service activities.

courses.name: Respiratory Pathophysiology
courses.description: Clinical pulmonary disease, organized around the gross structural components of the lung, airways, alveoli and pulmonary vasculature. Impact of disease on normal structurefunction; clinical, roentgenographic, and physiologic manifestations are described.

courses.name: Current Issues in Respiratory Care
courses.description: (cross-leveled with RS_THR 4930). Identification and analysis of current issues in Respiratory Care with practice implications. Emphasis given to identification and evaluation of nontraditional information sources (e.g., social networking, internet).
courses.prerequisites: CDS 4955 or HLTH SCI 3900 or Instructor consent
